outputs.output_descr:
The project aims to enhance accessibility to irrigation water through the upgrading of related production facilities and conveyance systems and improving its management systems. The intervention will give priority to activities which create the highest positive impact on the value chain for irrigated crops; activities which can significantly reduce cost and simultaneously improve the management of water resources. More specifically the project will achieve the following: 
•	Upgrading of 14 agricultural underground wells used for the irrigation of 5000 dumdums of land cultivated by 665 farmer households
•	Construction of 7 water storage steel (metal) reservoirs with a total storage capacity of 5250 m3 (750 m3 /reservoir) and equipped with complete output and input systems to be used for irrigating  2000 dunums cultivated by 265 farmer households. 
•	Upgrading of 13.4 km of main irrigation networks consist of 6`` and 4`` cement coated metal pipelines.  
•	Capacity Building for Water User Associations involved in the rehabilitated infrastructure.
•	Capacity Development (technical and institutional) for public extension and irrigation-related public services (the Ministry of Agriculture and the Palestinian Water Authority)

project_descr: Development of Irrigation Systems and Water Resources in the Jordan Valley and the North Western Districts of West Bank
project_title: Irrigation Systems and Water Resources in the West Bank
